speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Enter GHOST and HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Where wilt thou lead me? speak; I'll go no further.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Mark me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I will.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: My hour is almost come,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: When I to sulphurous and tormenting flames

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Must render up myself.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Alas, poor ghost!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Pity me not, but lend thy serious hearing

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: To what I shall unfold.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Speak; I am bound to hear.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: So art thou to revenge, when thou shalt hear.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What?

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: I am thy father's spirit,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Doom'd for a certain term to walk the night,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And for the day confined to fast in fires,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Till the foul crimes done in my days of nature

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Are burnt and purged away. But that I am forbid

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: To tell the secrets of my prison-house,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: I could a tale unfold whose lightest word

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Would harrow up thy soul, freeze thy young blood,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Make thy two eyes, like stars, start from their spheres,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Thy knotted and combined locks to part

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And each particular hair to stand on end,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Like quills upon the fretful porpentine:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: But this eternal blazon must not be

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: To ears of flesh and blood. List, list, O, list!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: If thou didst ever thy dear father love--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O God!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Revenge his foul and most unnatural murder.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Murder!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Murder most foul, as in the best it is;

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: But this most foul, strange and unnatural.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Haste me to know't, that I, with wings as swift

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As meditation or the thoughts of love,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: May sweep to my revenge.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: I find thee apt;

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And duller shouldst thou be than the fat weed

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: That roots itself in ease on Lethe wharf,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Wouldst thou not stir in this. Now, Hamlet, hear:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: 'Tis given out that, sleeping in my orchard,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: A serpent stung me; so the whole ear of Denmark

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Is by a forged process of my death

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Rankly abused: but know, thou noble youth,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: The serpent that did sting thy father's life

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Now wears his crown.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O my prophetic soul! My uncle!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Ay, that incestuous, that adulterate beast,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: With witchcraft of his wit, with traitorous gifts,--

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: O wicked wit and gifts, that have the power

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: So to seduce!--won to his shameful lust

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: The will of my most seeming-virtuous queen:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: O Hamlet, what a falling-off was there!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: From me, whose love was of that dignity

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: That it went hand in hand even with the vow

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: I made to her in marriage, and to decline

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Upon a wretch whose natural gifts were poor

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: To those of mine!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: But virtue, as it never will be moved,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Though lewdness court it in a shape of heaven,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: So lust, though to a radiant angel link'd,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Will sate itself in a celestial bed,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And prey on garbage.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: But, soft! methinks I scent the morning air;

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Brief let me be. Sleeping within my orchard,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: My custom always of the afternoon,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Upon my secure hour thy uncle stole,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: With juice of cursed hebenon in a vial,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And in the porches of my ears did pour

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: The leperous distilment; whose effect

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Holds such an enmity with blood of man

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: That swift as quicksilver it courses through

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: The natural gates and alleys of the body,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And with a sudden vigour doth posset

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And curd, like eager droppings into milk,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: The thin and wholesome blood: so did it mine;

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And a most instant tetter bark'd about,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Most lazar-like, with vile and loathsome crust,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: All my smooth body.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Thus was I, sleeping, by a brother's hand

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Of life, of crown, of queen, at once dispatch'd:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Cut off even in the blossoms of my sin,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Unhousel'd, disappointed, unanel'd,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: No reckoning made, but sent to my account

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: With all my imperfections on my head:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: O, horrible! O, horrible! most horrible!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: If thou hast nature in thee, bear it not;

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Let not the royal bed of Denmark be

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: A couch for luxury and damned incest.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: But, howsoever thou pursuest this act,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Taint not thy mind, nor let thy soul contrive

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Against thy mother aught: leave her to heaven

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And to those thorns that in her bosom lodge,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: To prick and sting her. Fare thee well at once!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: The glow-worm shows the matin to be near,

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: And 'gins to pale his uneffectual fire:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Adieu, adieu! Hamlet, remember me.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O all you host of heaven! O earth! what else?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And shall I couple hell? O, fie! Hold, hold, my heart;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And you, my sinews, grow not instant old,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But bear me stiffly up. Remember thee!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, thou poor ghost, while memory holds a seat

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In this distracted globe. Remember thee!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yea, from the table of my memory

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'll wipe away all trivial fond records,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: All saws of books, all forms, all pressures past,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That youth and observation copied there;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And thy commandment all alone shall live

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Within the book and volume of my brain,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Unmix'd with baser matter: yes, by heaven!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O most pernicious woman!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O villain, villain, smiling, damned villain!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My tables,--meet it is I set it down,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That one may smile, and smile, and be a villain;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: At least I'm sure it may be so in Denmark:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Writing

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So, uncle, there you are. Now to my word;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It is 'Adieu, adieu! remember me.'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I have sworn 't.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: [Within]  My lord, my lord,--

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: [Within] Lord Hamlet,--

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: [Within] Heaven secure him!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So be it!

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: [Within]  Hillo, ho, ho, my lord!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hillo, ho, ho, boy! come, bird, come.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter HORATIO and MARCELLUS

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: How is't, my noble lord?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: What news, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, wonderful!

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Good my lord, tell it.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No; you'll reveal it.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Not I, my lord, by heaven.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Nor I, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How say you, then; would heart of man once think it?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But you'll be secret?

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Ay, by heaven, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: There's ne'er a villain dwelling in all Denmark

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But he's an arrant knave.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: There needs no ghost, my lord, come from the grave

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: To tell us this.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, right; you are i' the right;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And so, without more circumstance at all,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I hold it fit that we shake hands and part:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You, as your business and desire shall point you;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For every man has business and desire,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Such as it is; and for mine own poor part,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Look you, I'll go pray.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: These are but wild and whirling words, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'm sorry they offend you, heartily;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yes, 'faith heartily.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: There's no offence, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yes, by Saint Patrick, but there is, Horatio,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And much offence too. Touching this vision here,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It is an honest ghost, that let me tell you:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For your desire to know what is between us,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O'ermaster 't as you may. And now, good friends,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As you are friends, scholars and soldiers,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Give me one poor request.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: What is't, my lord? we will.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Never make known what you have seen to-night.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: My lord, we will not.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, but swear't.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: In faith,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: My lord, not I.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: Nor I, my lord, in faith.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Upon my sword.

speaker: MARCELLUS
text_entry: We have sworn, my lord, already.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Indeed, upon my sword, indeed.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: [Beneath]  Swear.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ah, ha, boy! say'st thou so? art thou there,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: truepenny?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come on--you hear this fellow in the cellarage--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Consent to swear.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Propose the oath, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Never to speak of this that you have seen,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Swear by my sword.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: [Beneath]  Swear.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hic et ubique? then we'll shift our ground.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come hither, gentlemen,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And lay your hands again upon my sword:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Never to speak of this that you have heard,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Swear by my sword.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: [Beneath]  Swear.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Well said, old mole! canst work i' the earth so fast?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A worthy pioner! Once more remove, good friends.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: O day and night, but this is wondrous strange!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And therefore as a stranger give it welcome.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Than are dreamt of in your philosophy. But come;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Here, as before, never, so help you mercy,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How strange or odd soe'er I bear myself,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As I perchance hereafter shall think meet

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To put an antic disposition on,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That you, at such times seeing me, never shall,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With arms encumber'd thus, or this headshake,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or by pronouncing of some doubtful phrase,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As 'Well, well, we know,' or 'We could, an if we would,'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or 'If we list to speak,' or 'There be, an if they might,'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or such ambiguous giving out, to note

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That you know aught of me: this not to do,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So grace and mercy at your most need help you, Swear.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: [Beneath]  Swear.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Rest, rest, perturbed spirit!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They swear

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So, gentlemen,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With all my love I do commend me to you:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And what so poor a man as Hamlet is

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: May do, to express his love and friending to you,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: God willing, shall not lack. Let us go in together;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And still your fingers on your lips, I pray.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The time is out of joint: O cursed spite,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That ever I was born to set it right!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, come, let's go together.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt
